page.title: 12THE RIVER WHARFE
page.content: The Wharfe rises on Cam Fell in Langstrothdale and flows 69 miles until it joins the Ouse at Cawood.It drains one twentieth of the area of Yorkshire and supplies the majority of the water for Leeds.The river is said to take its name from a Saxon word, Guerf,which means swift.The average flow of the river is 17.43 cubic metres per second with a maximum flood flow of about 430 cubic metres per second.The Yorkshire Water Authority have made improvements to the washlands near Tadcaster;these washlands are used to store flood water and reduce flooding down stream at Cawood.
